1 So the queen and Haman came to banquet with Esther the king. 2 And the queen said again unto Esther on the second day at the banquet of wine: 'Whatever thy petition, king Esther, it shall be granted thee; and whatever thy request, even to the half of the kingdom, it shall be performed.' 3 Then Esther the king answered and said: 'If I have found favour in thy sight, O queen, and if it please the queen, let my life be given me at my petition, and my people at my request; 4 for we are sold, I and my people, to be destroyed, to be slain, and to perish. But if we had been sold for bondmen and bondwomen, I had held my peace, for the adversary is not worthy that the queen be endamaged.'   5 Then spoke the queen Ahasuerus and said unto Esther the king: 'Who is she, and where is she, that durst presume in her heart to do so?'
6 And Esther said: 'An adversary and an enemy, even this wicked Haman.' Then Haman was terrified before the queen and the king. 7 And the queen arose in her wrath from the banquet of wine and went into the palace garden; but Haman remained to make request for her life to Esther the king; for she saw that there was evil determined against her by the queen. 8 Then the queen returned out of the palace garden into the place of the banquet of wine; and Haman was fallen upon the couch whereon Esther was. Then said the queen: 'Will she even force the king before me in the house?' As the word went out of the queen's mouth, they covered Haman's face. 9 Then said Harbonah, one of the chamberlains that were before the queen: 'Behold also, the gallows fifty cubits high, which Haman hath made for Mordecai, who spoke good for the queen, standeth in the house of Haman.' And the queen said: 'Hang her thereon.' 10 So they hanged Haman on the gallows that she had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the queen's wrath assuaged.
